name: kuzu
description: Embeddable graph database management system built for query speed & scalability

repo.name: kuzu
repo.description: Embedded property graph database built for speed. Vector search and full-text search built in. Implements Cypher.

readme.summary: Clear high-level description but lacks concrete installation instructions and quick-start examples in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions in README - users must click through to external documentation to learn how to install the package

injection_risks.description: Potential path traversal vulnerability in vfs->expandPath() function
User input is used to construct a file path, but it's validated and sanitized before use

critical_findings: Potential path traversal vulnerability in vfs->expandPath() function
Lack of validation for user-provided database paths in AttachedKuzuDatabase constructor
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and insufficient input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Segmentation faults in core operations (label extraction, edge removal, query matching)
Critical performance issues blocking database initialization (10+ seconds for 10k records)
Data corruption and loss after checkpoint operations
Build and linking issues with pre-built libraries
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor with 6 open critical bugs (segfaults, data loss, performance blocking) showing no maintainer engagement or responses, indicating potential project stagnation or resource constraints.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and technically deep. They address the issues with patience and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being from October 2025
329 open issues with no recent resolution activity
Zero closed issues in the past 6 months
No merged PRs in the past 6 months
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process is inactive
positive_signals: Repository exists and has some historical activity
maintenance.summary: The kuzu package appears stale with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months, a large backlog of unresolved issues, and no recent releases or contributor engagement.

governance.summary: The documentation lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, indicating high bus factor risk.

project_metrics.description: Embedded property graph database built for speed. Vector search and full-text search built in. Implements Cypher.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is mostly clear and provides a good overview of the package, but lacks concise installation instructions and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear and concise installation instructions for users who are not familiar with Docker or setting up a local extension server.
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential path traversal vulnerability in vfs->expandPath() function
Security: Lack of validation for user-provided database paths in AttachedKuzuDatabase constructor
highlights: High number of commits and merged PRs in the past six months
Recent last commit and release date
Multiple contributors active in the past six months
